  * "Ferris Bueller' s Day Off" - This classic film from director John Hughes follows the adventures of high school student Ferris Bueller who decides to take a day off from school and goes to extreme lengths to pull it off, to the chagrin of his Dean, who'll do anything to stop him. (1986))
  * "Little Fockers" - This family film from director Robert De Niro follows the lives of three families: the Byrneses, the Fockers, and the Packerstons. Through their different experiences, the audience can see how the values and traditions of each family are passed down through generations. (2010))
  * "The Husband' s Secret" - This thriller film from director Matthew Broderick follows the story of a woman named Elizabeth who discovers a secret letter written by her husband. Elizabeth is torn between her love for her husband, which she believes has been true all along, and her growing suspicions about her husband's motives. As Elizabeth delves deeper into her husband's secrets, she becomes increasingly determined to uncover the truth about what really happened between her and her husband. (2013))
  * "Lilo & Stitch" - This animated film from director Chris Sanders follows the story of a young girl named Lilo who lives on a Hawaiian island with her pet pet dog named Stitch. One day, a group of evil aliens led by Dr. Eggman plan to conquer the world and force all its inhabitants to worship their alien gods. In order to prevent this terrible disaster from occurring, Lilo, Stitch, and a team of brave heroes led by Captain Nemo must embark on a dangerous and perilous journey across the vast and mysterious oceans of the farthest corners of the universe in order to stop Dr. Eggman and his evil alien minions from conquering the world and forcing all its inhabitants to worship their alien gods.

I would recommend "The Hiding Place" (1971) as a compelling and thought-provoking drama based on the true story of Corrie Ten Boom, an American Quaker who risked everything to hide Jewish refugees by the hundreds during World War II.
"The Hiding Place" starsCorrie Ten Boom herself, alongside her family members, including her husband Paul Ten Boom, their children John, Mimi, and Peter, as well as their daughter-in-law Phyllis Ten Boom.
